key_findings: Memory is concise and explicit about what should and should not be stored in git-tracked memory.
Go-live checklist is actionable and aligns with operational verification steps (Telegram inbound, delegation).
High productive output: large active diffs in Kalshi tooling are accompanied by tests; local pytest run is fast and green.
Retrieval/context efficiency is hard to score precisely due to limited standardized durable traces in-repo.
risk_flags: Token/secret handling appears across docs/code/config (no raw secrets detected by heuristic scan of git-tracked text files).
Potential focus drift: stated go-live objective vs large Kalshi tooling diffs.
Durable telemetry gaps limit auditability of retrieval hit-rate and search-before-act behavior.

recommendations.title: Maintain a stable memory index (objectives/projects/decisions/issues)
steps: Add one-line status/next-step per active project.

recommendations.title: Make working-memory freshness explicit
steps: Update the 'Last verified' date in /Users/corystoner/Desktop/ORION/memory/WORKING.md whenever checklist steps change.
If a checklist item is verified, reflect that in /Users/corystoner/Desktop/ORION/TODO.md or tasks queue.

recommendations.title: Add lightweight retrieval/context instrumentation for future audits
steps: Persist a short per-session 'context used' appendix in a durable location (e.g., tasks/ or memory/).
Record which memory entries were referenced and which constraints were applied.
